body:
I don't see why every piece of output a go program produces has to be as go
fmt would produce it. We have a tool that can do this for us so we don't
have to nickle and dime every single piece of output.

On Tue, 9 Aug 2016, 16:27 Hanno Hecker <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Please answer these questions before submitting your issue. Thanks!
>
>    1.
>
>    What version of Go are you using (go version)?
>    go version go1.6.3 linux/amd64
>    2.
>
>    What operating system and processor architecture are you using (go env
>    )?
>    GOARCH="amd64"
>    GOBIN=""
>    GOEXE=""
>    GOHOSTARCH="amd64"
>    GOHOSTOS="linux"
>    GOOS="linux"
>    GOPATH="/home/hhecker/go"
>    GORACE=""
>    GOROOT="/usr/local/go"
>    GOTOOLDIR="/usr/local/go/pkg/tool/linux_amd64"
>    GO15VENDOREXPERIMENT="1"
>    CC="gcc"
>    GOGCCFLAGS="-fPIC -m64 -pthread -fmessage-length=0"
>    CXX="g++"
>    CGO_ENABLED="1"
>    3.
>
>    What did you do?
>    If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error.
>    The following is used to generate code via go run example.go >
>    output.go:
>
> package main
> import "fmt"
> func main() {
>         data := map[string]interface{}{"key": "value"}
>         fmt.Printf("package main\n\nvar data = %#v\n", data)
> }
>
> Running gofmt -d on the output shows
>
> diff output.go gofmt/output.go
> --- /tmp/gofmt472599174 2016-08-09 08:24:53.951200879 +0200
> +++ /tmp/gofmt828973101 2016-08-09 08:24:53.951200879 +0200
> @@ -1,3 +1,3 @@
>  package main
>
> -var data = map[string]interface {}{"key":"value"}
> +var data = map[string]interface{}{"key": "value"}
>
>
>    1.
>
>    What did you expect to see?
>    Nothing :)
>    2.
>
>    What did you see instead?
>    the above whitespace changes
>
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/golang/go/issues/16645>, or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAAcA5LOaNjHw2CLgVr4LmPXaCVc6Ahfks5qeB3dgaJpZM4JfwZa>
> .
>
